cot.content:

question:
when does isle of dogs come out in us
        
Generation Format:
Reasoning process:
Answer:

Reasoning process: 
To determine when "Isle of Dogs" was released in the US, I need to recall the film's release history. "Isle of Dogs" is a stop-motion animated film directed by Wes Anderson. It premiered at the Berlin International Film Festival on February 15, 2018. Following its festival premiere, it was released in theaters in the United States. 

Typically, films that premiere at festivals have a staggered release schedule, often debuting in theaters a few weeks or months later. For "Isle of Dogs," I need to check the specific date it was released in the US after its festival showing.

After confirming the release date, I can provide the answer.

Answer: "Isle of Dogs" was released in the US on March 23, 2018.

anchoring.content:

when does isle of dogs come out in us

"Isle of Dogs" began a limited release in the U.S. on March 23, 2018. It was released nationwide in the United States on April 13, 2018.\n', '"Isle of Dogs" was released on digital on June 26, 2018, and on DVD and Blu-ray on July 17, 2018.\n', 'A US–German co-production, "Isle of Dogs" was produced by Indian Paintbrush and Anderson\'s own production company, American Empirical Pictures, in association with Studio Babelsberg. The film opened the 68th Berlin International Film Festival, where Anderson was awarded the Silver Bear for Best Director. It was given a limited release in the United States on March 23, 2018, by Fox Searchlight Pictures, and went on wide release on April 13. It has grossed over $64 million worldwide, and received praise for its animation, story, and deadpan humor. A manga adaptation of the film by Minetarō Mochizuki was published in 2018, beginning with the May 24 issue of "Weekly Morning". The film received nominations at the 76th Golden Globe Awards, 72nd British Academy Film Awards, and 91st Academy Awards, all for Best Animated Feature Film and Best Original Score.\n', 'Anderson returned to stop motion animation with "Isle of Dogs". Production on the film started in the United Kingdom in October 2016, and it was released in select theaters on March 23, 2018, and wide on April 6, 2018. In August 2018, it was reported that Anderson was working on his next film, set in post-war France, and was set to begin filming at Angoulême, beginning in November 2018.\n', 'BULLET::::- "Isle of Dogs" (2018), dir. question_info.question: when does isle of dogs come out in us
passages:
The film premiered as the opening film of the 68th Berlin International Film Festival on February 15, 2018, and had its North American premiere as the closing film of the SXSW Film Festival in Austin, Texas, on March 17, 2018. "Isle of Dogs" began a limited release in the U.S. on March 23, 2018. It was released nationwide in the United States on April 13, 2018.
"Isle of Dogs" was released on digital on June 26, 2018, and on DVD and Blu-ray on July 17, 2018.
A US–German co-production, "Isle of Dogs" was produced by Indian Paintbrush and Anderson's own production company, American Empirical Pictures, in association with Studio Babelsberg. The film opened the 68th Berlin International Film Festival, where Anderson was awarded the Silver Bear for Best Director. It was given a limited release in the United States on March 23, 2018, by Fox Searchlight Pictures, and went on wide release on April 13. It has grossed over $64 million worldwide, and received praise for its animation, story, and deadpan humor. A manga adaptation of the film by Minetarō Mochizuki was published in 2018, beginning with the May 24 issue of "Weekly Morning". The film received nominations at the 76th Golden Globe Awards, 72nd British Academy Film Awards, and 91st Academy Awards, all for Best Animated Feature Film and Best Original Score.
Anderson returned to stop motion animation with "Isle of Dogs". Production on the film started in the United Kingdom in October 2016, and it was released in select theaters on March 23, 2018, and wide on April 6, 2018. In August 2018, it was reported that Anderson was working on his next film, set in post-war France, and was set to begin filming at Angoulême, beginning in November 2018.
BULLET::::- "Isle of Dogs" (2018), dir. Wes Anderson
